Pre-Game Insights: Atlanta Braves are leading the series 1-0 against the Kansas City Royals.
Atlanta Braves are 87-71 overall and 44-33 in home games.
Kansas City Royals are 85-75 overall and 40-39 on the road.
The Braves have a strong record when they record at least eight hits in a game.
The Royals have hit 168 total home runs this season, ranking them 10th in the AL.
The teams are playing their second game of the season against each other.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is part of a three-game series between the Braves and Royals.
Jorge Soler has 31 doubles, a triple, and 21 home runs for the Braves.
Michael Harris II has been strong in his last 10 games with 18-for-44 performance.
Bobby Witt Jr. has 45 doubles, 11 triples, and 32 home runs for the Royals.
Salvador Perez has been struggling recently with a.195 batting average in his last 10 games.
